column4: help... I need a video file player that doesn't depend on any other library
it's asking me for libavcodec53
but I can't get it installed
Have you tried VLC? It bundles its own libraries as far as I know
Why can't you install libavcodec package? It's part of the default repository
What error do you get?
It's possible to download the files on any OS directly from the Ubuntu website. And then just put them on a USB flash disk, and open on Ubuntu
What error did you get when trying to install the .deb manually?
It should tell you that. Do you get any messages if you try installing it via the command line? (sudo dpkg -i package.deb)
Sorry, not sure what else to suggest... You could try the Windows installer of VLC with Wine I guess?
Can't you watch it on the uni computers? You can download standalone VLC to run from a flash drive
It shouldn't make a difference. Only the desktop environment is different, all the software is identical
Without wanting to be patronising, did you download the right libavcodec for your particular version of Ubuntu?
Do you know which version you're on? I can send you a link
You can get packages from http://packages.ubuntu.com/oneiric/libavcodec53 but the interface is a bit confusing
There are links on the upper right to switch between different Ubuntu versions, such as oneiric, precise etc.
11.04 it was the lasted released... I think so
Do you know if your computer is running 32 or 64 bit? There are different packages for each
You could try http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/liba/libav/libavcodec53_0.7.3-0ubuntu0.11.10.1_i386.deb

You're right, it lists a few dependencies on the page http://packages.ubuntu.com/oneiric/libavcodec53 so it might complain without them. Unfortunately Ubuntu software assumes Internet Connectivity, without it's a real pain in the ass
There probably is some clever way to download a lot of deb's at once for offline usage. The problem is there are so many, it would be massive unless you filter it to a specific selection
multimedia and 3D
